pros: Westbrook has shaped my career from the beginning. They care about the clients they serve and the staff. I feel that we make a positive impact on the community. The benefits are great.
cons: It can be stressful at times

pros: Benefits are great, coworkers are always helpful.
cons: Hours, management favors some employees over others.

review_title: Wouldn't advise anyone to work here.
pros: I cannot think of any.
cons: Very few management people know what they are doing. The way things operate change constantly. The ones who start trouble are the ones promoted.

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Parkersburg, WV
pros: Ok job pays pretty good
cons: Working environment is not greaf

pros:
Flexible time
Friendly people
Ability to transfer within company
cons:
Unequal rewards and bonuses
Physical appearance of building is lacking
There are staff that simply don’t care about others,

pros: Flexible schedule, generous PTO, medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, 403(b)
cons: Limited room to grow, minimal raises for experience or loyalty to company

pros: Laid back and overall nice people.
cons: The hourly is a joke, everyone very low paid in the whole building.  Management plays favorite with employees.  Extreme lack of training and they don't hold anyone accountable to help new employees. Lack of information of programs and streamlines to get things done. Lacking in all departments.  I wouldn't recommend this place ever to anyone. RUN! There is no way to move up for more pay either, they refused to negotiate pay and refuse to ever increase the pay. HELLO?! people need to pay bills!!

pros: Cant really come up with anything. Not even weekends off.
cons: Low rates of pay to start, no raises, insurance is lacking, no "perk" benefits, lack of leadership.

review_title: Good Starter Job, Not a career
pros: Good holiday and vacation package, Okay benefits
cons: Lack of advancement opportunities, pay

pros: There are some extremely competent and amazing people to work with in this company.   Caring for, and advocating for clients, is a rewarding experience.
cons: Pay is not commensurate with expectations for employees. There is  little to no effort by upper and middle management to know us, so they don't appreciate any unique or special abilities we may possess.   Middle-aged women, who aren't counselors or management, are NOT treated with respect for their education, knowledge and experience.  There is a condescending manner toward women of age, even among those who think they are "enlightened".

review_title: Steady work in a changing world
job_title: Consumer Assistant I in Parkersburg, WV
pros: Pay is above minimum wage.  You'll get 40+ hours per week, and the benefits package is pretty decent. Since the work is done in client homes, one meal per shift will be provided for you.
cons: You're expected to be available 24/7 to come in and cover shifts.  You can be written up if a supervisor calls you to cover a shift and you don't answer your phone.  You can be mandated to stay an extra 8 hours with very little notice.  Your enjoyment of your job is directly related to the other staff that you work with, and who your supervisor is.

review_title: Overall it has been a very positive experience working for Westbrook.
pros: I enjoy working with the other staff to accomplish the same goals.
cons: Salary is not equal to other jobs in the area for the same basic work.

pros: The work is not that hard and you get very attached to the clients.
cons: Management is so inconsistent, very little respect for employees. They constantly tell employees what they are doing wrong but never give any praise.

review_title: Terrible at best for employee mental health
pros: Helping the clients, seeing positive change over time in their lives. Somewhat flexible schedule. Opportunity for CEUs for those currently attending school.
cons: Poor communication between all departments. Supervisor that doesn't listen to you. Huge case loads. Responsibilities are heaped on you left and right. Massive amounts of paperwork. No such thing as a raise. No overtime, yet not enough time to complete all the documentation.

pros: Company Cars were offered to drive to home visits and meetings away from the office, but this was on a first come first serve basis. The exception to this is that preference was given to divisions that brought in more income.
cons:
Management showed favoritism
Case Loads were too heavy 
No way to move up in the company

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Parkersburg, WV
pros: Very caring environment. Great coworkers. Some amazing bosses. Enjoy working here.
cons: Pay is awful but the company does a lot for different communities and our people.

review_title: Lousy, a very female dominated organization with a poor system for handling employee complaints.
pros: Flexible schedule provided you are ok with last minute changes
cons: High client to employee ratio, Dr office is over six months in rears relative to scheduling

pros: I feel fortunate to work at Westbrook. So many caring people, supportive management team, great benefits and room for advancement!
cons: caring for people can sometimes be stressful.

pros: Bonding with the children is why I stayed
cons: The extremely low pay is why I'm leaving

review_title: Not a great place to work

pros: The clients were the highlight of the job.
